contentrichtext.text: {{Nihongo|'''Takano'''|高野町|Takano-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Hiba District, Hiroshima|Hiba District]], [[Hiroshima Prefecture|Hiroshima]], [[Japan]]. On March 31, 2005 Takano, along with the towns of [[Hiwa, Hiroshima|Hiwa]], [[Kuchiwa, Hiroshima|Kuchiwa]], [[Saijō, Hiroshima|Saijō]] and [[Tōjō, Hiroshima|Tōjō]], all from [[Hiba District, Hiroshima|Hiba District]], and the town of [[Sōryō, Hiroshima|Sōryō]], from [[Kōnu District, Hiroshima|Kōnu District]], was merged into the expanded city of [[Shōbara, Hiroshima|Shōbara]]. As of March 2011, the town had a [[population]] of 2,120 and a [[population density|density]] of 13.32 persons per km². The total area was 159.18 km². ==External links== * [http://www.city.shobara.hiroshima.jp/ Shōbara official website] {{ja icon}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Hiroshima Prefecture]] {{Hiroshima-geo-stub}}
